newsitem.title: POLAND: FORECAST - Banks see zloty at 2.8553 vs dlr end-96.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Banks see zloty at 2.8553 vs dlr end-96.

text.p: The Polish zloty is seen easing against the dollar by year-end, but the prediction is more optimistic than last month, according to a Reuter poll of the country's 25 largest banks.
By the end of 1996, the zloty is expected to fall to 2.8553 to the dollar versus Tuesday's fixing of 2.7965, the poll showed.
The 2.8553 rate is a mean average of forecasts that ranged between 2.8050 and 2.9000.
Last month, banks had predicted a fall in the Polish unit to 2.8768 at year-end. Forecasts ranged from 2.8000 to 2.8750.
The zloty is expected to trade at an average of 2.8215 in November with a range of forecasts between 2.7300 and 2.8460.
Banks estimated the zloty would fall to an average of 3.1358 to the dollar in November 1997 with a range of forecasts from 3.0500 to 3.3500.
